file_content.text: What are the terrorists doing here?
Tell me about my target.
Sorry about that, Cipher Nine. Welcome to the eastern galactic front.
This whole star system is a crisis point. Republic and Empire are testing one another's strength. Meanwhile, the terrorists lurk in the middle.
It's a perfect place to operate, isn't it?
I'm getting the picture.
Exactly right.
Good to see a pretty face.
[Flirt] Hello there.
So long as I'm not just a pretty face. Pity the circumstances have to be unpleasant.
Good to see a friendly face.
Hello, Watcher Two.
Good seeing you as well. I'm sorry the circumstances have to be unpleasant.
So to sum up, I'm walking into a war zone.
Can't get much worse.
That's essentially correct. It can't be avoided, however.
The Eagle's men are using the war as a cover for local activities. Balmorra is their training ground.
Cell members recruit, instruct and arm new terrorists here--fresh soldiers destined for other points in the network. It's a vital part of the system.
So where do I sign up to join?
Perfect for infiltration.
That, I can't tell you. But you have the right idea.
Understood.
If Imperial Intelligence is aware of this, why hasn't anything been done?
Why haven't you stopped them?
We knew of the Balmorran situation, but we didn't know the depth of the problem--and it didn't seem urgent, at the time.
To dismantle the terror cell there, you'll need local support. I'm alerting one of our officials to your presence.
Lekern Renald is the station chief in Sobrik, the Imperial settlement where you landed. He runs Intelligence operations on Balmorra and can brief you more thoroughly.
What's your assessment of the man?
Can I trust him?
He's worked for us for decades. I've never met him, but I expect he's loyal.
Is there more I should know?
Anything else?
Maybe I'll just start shooting and see who turns up.
That's such a boring approach.
If you like, but I wouldn't advise it.
Renald runs his affairs out of the back of an arms dealership. He'll be waiting for you when you arrive.
Move quickly on this one, Cipher Nine, and watch what you say. If things go bad, you'll have half a planet gunning for you.
This is Watcher Two. Just a moment... I'm having trouble with the signal...
There. Secure transmission established.
Cut the chitchat and let's get to business.
No small talk, please.
Of course. I'll keep this brief.
Years ago, we took Balmorra from the Republic. Now that the war's heating up again, they want the planet back.
I'm getting some distortion, Watcher Two.
What was that static?
The comm satellites around Balmorra have taken a serious beating. Not surprising, really.
This is Lodenth Kashar; secure transmission established.
Apologies, Cipher Nine--Watcher Two is coordinating another operation, but we may review general information while you wait.
Balmorra was an independent corporate world subjugated during the war. Since the treaty, a resistance movement has violently opposed Imperial governance.
We believe elements of this Balmorran resistance are secretly supported by the Republic, but Imperial High Command is unconvinced and the information is not public.
No one suspects the Republic?
We're supposed to be at peace.
Our evidence comes from classified sources and is not definitive proof; despite rumors on the ground, the Republic can maintain deniability.
Watcher Two shall--ah. I will excuse myself.
